body.description: Travel, trek, wander or roam with the J is for Jeep Brand Cross-Country Sport Plus Jogger. A versatile jogging stroller, it showcases how luxury and extreme capability combine to help you create unforgettable journeys with your child. Equipped with durable frame, front swivel wheel, and an extendable European canopy with sun visor and peek-a-boo window, it’s designed for parents and kids with an active lifestyle. Able to tackle the toughest trails, the J is for Jeep Brand Cross-Country Sport Plus Jogger still has the little luxuries you expect from Jeep; high quality nylon fabrics, reflective material for nighttime runs and a multi-position reclining seat with five-point safety harness with soft shoulder pads. Innovative materials, impressive value and cool features like the convenient parent tray with covered phone storage and over-sized on-the-go parent organizer for diapers, drinks or clothes all adds up to create a groundbreaking jogging stroller that keeps you prepared for just about any occasion—no matter where the trail takes you and your little explorer. Recommended use: Infants up to 50 lbs. Fits the following car seats (car seats sold separately): Graco SnugRide Click Connect Evenflo Nurture; Evenflo Embrace Britax B-Safe 35 Chicco KeyFit 30 (separate adapter provided)

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: About Jeep ince 1941, Jeep has been a symbol of freedom and expression. Influenced by a love of the great outdoors. Jeep kids' products are created for life’s little adventurers. Jeep Cross-Country Sport Plus Jogger Available in Charcoal Galaxy Take your little one with you on your next adventure! Designed for parents and kids with an active lifestyle, the Jeep Cross-Country Sport Plus Jogger is ideal for lovers of the outdoors. Durable steel frame with highest quality tech fabric Includes detachable carryall parent organizer Extendable, quilted European canopy with sun visor and peek-a-boo window Multi-position reclining seat with five-point safety harness and soft shoulder pads Swing-away child tray for easy infant loading Quick release back tires for compact folding Convenient fabric parent tray with two cup holders and covered storage compartment to keep essentials at hand Fits the Following Car Seats (sold separately):Graco SnugRide Click Connect, Evenflo Nurture, Evenflo Embrace, Chicco KeyFit 30 (separate adapter provided for this specific car seat)

Features Ample Storage Space Generous undercarriage storage bin to pack for your long, adventurous journey. Accommodating Handle Wide, adjustable foam handle provides the perfect fit for parents of all heights. Destined for Adventure Large 16 inch back metal air spoke wheels with ball bearings; Front 12 inch swivel metal air spoke wheel with swivel lock. These wheels were made for trekking.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love it! Just a few small inconveniences I can live with.
reviews.reviewText: I love this stroller! It's good on grass, gravel, bumpy terrain, and of course a smooth ride for everyday things like shopping. I like the extra storage of the parent bag and the convenience of the parent cup holders with storage in between them. I keep a compact bicycle pump and extra inner tubes along with feeding and diaper changing stuff in the parent bag and I keep the bug net in the little compartment between the cup holders. I don't like to be caught without everything I need! It's easy to turn and move around. I love that it has the tether so baby won't roll away if you fall and it's not attached to the handle where baby would go down with you. I definitely like the longer canopy and peek-a-boo window. The adjustable handle has been great for me because I'm short and now I don't have to reach so high to push it but everyone else is tall and the handle can be adjusted up for them in only about a second. I liked that it comes with the adapters for the different car seats so you have what you need. I love that the child's tray can swing around on either side. It has come in very handy for diaper changes on the go when there weren't any changing stations or they were so gross that I would never put my baby near it! I like the quick release back wheels and the lock on the front wheel to keep it straight for going faster that walking speed.Now what I don't like. I don't like that the seat doesn't sit up all the way and my son strains to see over the tray and sit up straighter. To fold this particular model, not only do you have to lay down the seat but you have to adjust the handle up if there is anything in the parent bag. I don't like that the bottom storage gets in the way of the front wheel when you're folding it and I have to turn the front wheel sideways to get the side latch to hook to keep it folded. The handle padding peels away especially if you bump it on the ground while you're folding it. I don't like the way the shoulder straps sit on my son, his shoulders come out of the straps if he wiggles too much but he is a small 8 month old. I just feel that it would be safer if it had a chest clip like car seats have to keep the straps in place. For the record he has never actually gotten a full arm out of the straps no matter how har he has tried, just the tops of his shoulders.Overall, I love it and I would recommend it to anyone else. It just has a few small inconveniences that I can live with.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It was just what we needed
reviews.reviewText: Nice , leight weight. Easy to take out the car when needed. I knew it was time to get my granddaughter a stroller. I wanted a really nice one and durable. It works great , we can run , walk She loves it, we love it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this stroller.
reviews.reviewText: It is so easy to push. It folds up easily but does take up more room than some strollers but not a big deal for my Jeep. I love that it has a peep clear plastic in the visor to see my daughter

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great stroller. Baby loves it.so light and easy
reviews.reviewText: So light and easy to maneuver. The big wheels makes it a breeze to stroll baby around. It's easy to get baby in and out of. Rolls so easy over most anything. Bottom line...it's the easiest and best stroller I've ever used. Love it, and it looks great also.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for short people
reviews.reviewText: I am 5 ft tall and this stroller is perfect for me and still great for my 5’ 10” husband. A jogging stroller I had returned in the past was very tall and I couldn’t see over the canopy, this one is a very comfortable height and the adjustable hand bar makes it perfect for my husband as well. I got this stroller because our sidewalks are too uneven to use our regular Stroller and it was a nice price and compatible with our Chicco keyfit 30 car seat. It takes some wiggling and elbow grease to get the car seat in and out, but once you get used to it it’s not a big deal. The storage is smaller compared to other strollers, but it’s perfect for us using it to go on walks, it can still hold our jackets, and other things we may need. Overall perfect for what I needed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Jeep vs. Graco
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this stroller to replace my 5 year old Graco jogger that I gave away thinking I didn't need it anymore. Unfortunately I was wrong so I ordered this based on the price and how it looked. So far the quality of the stroller seems great, the canopy is gigantic and it's very easy to maneuver. It really does exactly what it needs to do. When compared to the Graco, I like the style of this stroller better but the functionality is definitely lacking. The Jeep stroller requires 2 hands in order to collapse whereas the Graco only requires one. Another random flaw is that the Jeep's child tray doesn't have a single cupholder while the Graco child tray had 2! Now probably the biggest reason why I deducted a star from my review was because of the storage basket. I use an average-size backpack diaper bag and it just does not fit. I have to remove items and then force it into the basket while slowly destroying the bag itself. It was a nightmare at first but I've found ways to adjust to it and pack differntly. It's unfortunate that other than carrying my diaper bag, the Jeep basket is basically useless. My Graco basket was gigantic and allowed space for toys or shopping. Overall, yes the stroller is great for the price. If this is your first jogging stroller than go for it but if you've already owned the Graco then just stick to that brand.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars What an upgrade!
reviews.reviewText: I have no vehicle and live in New England. I had to walk up a STEEP hill everyday to get my child to daycare. This hill is not a road just a path so unplowed. I had to carry the baby and my old stroller up that hill until I got this stroller. Nothing stops this stroller. It goes over snow, logs, rocks anything! My daughter doesnt bump around as much (on bigger obstacles she still does) I tried going over a 3in curb without lifting the front tire and while my daughter may have gotten tossed around a bit (shes 16m so she loved it) it did indeed go over without issue. If you're going down hill this stroller will try and fly down it.Other things I loved.1. Great storage space!2. Adjustable handle! I adjust it all the time.3. Locking front wheel. If going down stairs or through snow it is a life saver.4. Saftey strap. When going down steep or slippery hills I have the added comfort of knowing she wont go flying downhill if I have a fall.Cons.1. Bulky to store (but tires come off/on VERY easily)2. You have to recliner the seat all the way to fold it up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is perfect for getting back to my workout routine! It glides so well, and just overall makes an easy run! I love this stroller. It’s so convenient as well!
